intro: Cadaba heterotricha, commonly known as the African snowball or wild coffee, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, clustered flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for arid environments. Its floral structure and growth habit make it a notable species in its native habitat.
